title: Gamuda wins approval for St Kilda Road office tower
excerpt: VCAT has approved Gamuda Land's application for an 18-storey residential tower on St Kilda Road, overriding a permit amendment from the City of Port Phillip to cut the tower's height by two storeys.
imageAlt: Gamuda St Kilda Road office tower approval
author: Building Environs

sections.alt: Gamuda St Kilda Road tower development - Image credit: Gamuda Land

sections.content: VCAT has approved [Gamuda Land's](https://gamudaland.com.au/) application for an 18-storey residential tower on St Kilda Road, overriding a permit amendment from the City of Port Phillip to cut the tower's height by two storeys.

Originally purchased for $9.75 million, the site at 95 St Kilda Road will soon be home to a $35 million development housing 78 apartments. There will also be a caf√© and a 102 square metre co-working space. BayleyWard Architects are responsible for the design.

This latest project joins a suite of iconic builds for the Malaysian-based developer, which entered Australia in 2014. Its other projects include a 20-storey residential development in South Melbourne, a $180 million development in Fisherman's Bend, and a 30-storey landmark development with hotel-like amenities on Chapel Street.
